answerText: Gwendolyn Brooks[10] This poet who teaches at Emory won the 2007 Pulitzer Prize for her collection Native Guard, which featured elegies for her mixed-race mother. She was appointed as U.S. Poet Laureate in 2012.
heading: Western Invitational Tournament |2013 | Bentley Gioia Hunter Lopez-Lago | 8 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Name these female African-American poets, for 10 points each. [10] This woman was the first African-American to win the Pulitzer Prize for poetry with her collection Annie Allen. She also wrote "We Real Cool" and A Street in Bronzeville.
